Hence, whenever the critical editions establish a Latin text older than that of Gh, this fact should be faithfully reported for the benefit of scholarship. Cf. also below, ch. 4. The position of Gh within the stemma codicum is less clear cut than could be desired; in Book IV it cannot, as UNDHAGEN avers for his edition of Book I", be regarded as codicis instar. Instead, it is a text compiled from manuscripts close to K and F, but not lineally descended from the n hyparchetype, as the following examples will indicate. IV 76:14 pars et] pauperes K pauperes et Gh: a most significant error on the part of K Gh. The double meaning of the Greek word xkfieg ("lot, piece of land, inheritance", and "clergy"), borrowed into Church Latin in the form clerus, must have been perfectly clear to both Birgitta herself and her translators'. The Old Swedish version reflects this awareness55 (BU 11:149, 15 "Än huat äru klärkane ytan gudz lutir oc almosomän" — "What else are the clergy but God's heritage and almsmen"). The archetype of the passage under discussion undoubtedly read pars, a word which is at variance with three parallel passages, where sors' is the word used; as it is a matter of doubt whether the reading pars is erroneous for sors or a less successful translation of clerus, I have retained it in the text. K (and, in its wake, Gh) fails completely to take the point and changes pars into pauperes.' The similarities shared by K Gh, on the other hand, are often due to a use of synonyms or variant 
 
 
 
 
 41 forms. Since, finally, both K and F contain errors of omission not shared by either the other manuscripts or Gh, we must conclude that the Vadstena brothers who edited Gh must have used as their source at least two manuscripts, closely related to but not identical with K and F, and that they selected their text from these two sources, and possibly others, too. In the case of the text rubrics, which are consistently lacking in F in Rev. IV 1-130, the exemplar of Gh cannot but be K or a manuscript closely related to it. 2.3 Addiciones et Declaraciones: Kqux qUa F Gh The Addiciones and Declaraciones have not reached us in a consistent fashion. In the manuscripts used for the main part of this edition, these sections of the text are completely absent from the [3 manuscripts; they are most consistently handed down by K58 (or K2)59, q, F", and Gh, to a slightly lesser degree by Ua61 , and more sporadically by ux62 . The question of the relationship between these manuscripts is complicated by the shortness of the texts involved and by the lack of significant errors. There is, moreover, no reason to expect all Addiciones and Declaraciones to have been added to the text at the same time and by the same path; hence relationships observed within one section of the text may not be valid in others. One constant trait may nevertheless be noted, namely the consistency with which q and Ua share errors, such as: IV 32:8 trinus et F deus et q et deus Ua om. K Gh. Despite the varied word order, the readings of q and Ua are obviously wrong in their context, while it is very difficult to decide whether it is F or K Gh that give the authentic reading. Gh) pro eodem (pro eodem om. q pro eodem papa Gh) in festo sancti policarpi qux Gh IV 143:5 salutem et om. Kqux 2.5 The Geminated Revelations: Rev. IV 1, 3, 4, 17, 45, 48, 74, and 103-105 Originally, the Liber Alfonsi contained only Books I to VII, as is evident from the Explicit found in the manuscripts of the p group'. To these seven books Alfonso later added an eighth, the Liber celestis imperatoris ad reges, which he made up partly from Revelations contained in the earlier books, partly from such Revela- tions as he had excluded from the first collection. This had the effect that twenty-four Revelations' occurred twice over, first in Books II to VII66, then in Book VIII; this fact must soon have been noted by the scribes, who probably considered it unnecessary to write the same text twice. This in tuin gave rise to the question of which text to exclude: that in Books II to VII or that in Book VIII. Among modern scholars KRAFT (1929:77ff.) has discussed this phenomenon in detail; assuming that the Liber celestis originally contained only Book I—VII and that the Liber celestis ad reges was a separate collection altogether67, he concluded that the exclusion of one of each of the geminated Revelations began after their having been merged into one codex, that is, the one which is now known as the "Second Alfonso Redaction"68. KRAFT based his discussion on a study of the arrangement of the Revelations in B, F, K, and Gh, but did not notice the textual variations of the Revelations involved: the latter point is important, as it is pos- sible, through a comparison of these versions, to trace the development and character of Alfonso's revisions69. I shall return to this question below. KRAFT'S Cf. Cf. (1901:22ff.), whose arguments have been reinforced by UNDHAGEN (1978:16ff.)  44 discussion is too brief and, lacking a tabular arrangement of the facts, rather difficult to follow'. The solution adopted by the various scribes appears from Table 1 (below, p. 55). If the consistency, or lack of it, with which the Revelations of Book II —VII have been retained suo loco or referred away to Book VIII may be used as an indicator allowing us to trace the history of the redactions, Table 1 would permit the following conclusions. Firstly, all the manuscripts of the 13 group retain all twenty-four Revelations in both locations: it is a fair assumption that this group, therefore, represents the oldest editorial arrangement of the text.71 Secondly, F obeys no consistent system: in Book II the Revelations are retained, in Book VII, they have been left out, while in Book IV the texts are rather haphazardly retained or truncated. It is probably safe to assume that F belongs to a marginally later stratum than f3.72 A third method is followed by Kx73, where all ten Revelations of Book IV and three out of five in Book II are truncated, the text containing a reference to the corresponding passage in Book VIII. Rev. II 12 and 1374, and all seven Revelations of Books VI and VII are geminated. The lack of consistency in referring the reader to Book VIII or retaining the text suo loco shows that this group, too belongs to an early stratum, albeit not so early a one as 13 and F. In K, a second scribe, designated K2 , has later added the text of the truncated Revelations at the end of the codex, for the express reason that the manuscript should be complete and in all respects identical with those that were per doctores examinatos et defensatos.75 So doing, K2 has provided us with the full text of the geminated Revelations, as eventually printed by Gh. 7() Some of his statements are also completely in error, as for instance his observations on Codd.  45 Yet other manuscripts, such as q and Fb, h and S76 (the latter two are not exhibited in Table 1) exhibit an increasing degree of consistency, whereby the where the Revelations are truncated, to reader is referred from Books Book VIII. It is reasonable to take this as a sign that these manuscripts represent later stages in the history of redaction. As mentioned above (section 1.2), Fb, written in 1386, is the oldest dated Revelations manuscript. Since, on the other hand, the very latest possible dating for the complete Liber celestis Reuelacionum (including the ES and Liber VIII) is September 137977, those manuscripts ex- hibiting what I consider an older arrangement of the geminated Revelations must have been composed (or, at least, copied from a manuscript composed) after this date but considerably before 1386: a very short period of time. The full discussion of this problem will have to be postponed until the full material can be presented, in my forthcoming edition of Liber VIII. Finally, the Editio princeps, Gh, is wholly consistent within itself but adopts the while in opposite system: all Revelations concerned are printed in Books Book VIII the same texts have been truncated and the reader is referred back to the first location. This appears to be the final stage in the development. One Revelation, II 12 (= VIII 36), is consistently doubled in all manuscripts except F. It follows that we have a rather narrow basis for the reconstruction of the oldest Alfonsine text of these Revelations, as only the f manuscripts and K2 and Gh retain the full wording, whereas F gives most of the text (Rev. IV 1, 17, 45, 103-105) and q is of use only in Rev. IV 45. Our first task is then to evaluate the text of these manuscripts and the Editio princeps. Now, as has been pointed out many times', Alfonso revised the text of these Revelations when he added them to Book VIII. The revision mostly took the form of his adding words and phrases that would help make his point more clearly and sometimes considerably changed the wording of the text.' Our first task must therefore be to establish which, if any, of the manuscripts listed best renders the text of these Revelations before they were edited by Alfonso for Book VIII".  46 certain amount of ground has already been covered, chiefly on the nature of Alfonso's editorial activities, and the full discussion of this question must wait until the edition of Book VIII' A few facts may be summarised here. First, there are numerous instances of additions to the text that can only be observed in those manuscripts — chiefly those of the fl group — which report the text of Book VIII suo loco. Thus, the text of the rubrics has generally been completely rewritten. In these instances, the wording of the Incipit is often also amplified, as in IV 3:1 "0, Domine," inquit sponsa, which in VIII 41:1 has been changed to Loquebatur sponsa ad Christum orando pro regno Suecie inter alia dicens: "Domine," inquit. Moreover, explanations, clarifying the context and giving it more point, have been added to the text; thus IV 3:16 ad legittimum possessorem is expanded into VIII 41:16 ad legittimum dominum, id est ad illum regem, heredem predecessoris regis concedentis. Secondly, there is another major group of additions which have made their way, not only into the text of Book VIII written suo loco, but also into the corresponding text of Book IV, as reported by various manuscripts and by Gh. The most import- ant additions of this class are': IV 4:3 domine tibi notel domine regine tibi note de qua alias dixi tibi Gh regine de qua iam alias tibi dixi VIII 13:4 IV 4:6 multumque computarel et teneri ad reddendum longam et onerosam racionem K2 Gh et VIII 13:6 IV 4:15 et passim infusio] infusio dyabolica Gh infusio dyaboli VIII 13:15 IV 45:1 maiestate] imperiali maiestate K2 F Gh et VIII 50:1 IV 48:1 iste] iste rex Gh et VIII 7:1 IV 74:15 ergo] ergo miles K2 Gh et VIII 34:15 IV 74:24 deserves extra comment. The Book IV tradition runs: Omnis quippe, qui diligit proximum, tenetur primum dolere, quod omnes, qui sunt redempti sangui- ne Ihesu Christi, non rependunt Deo dileccionem. This wording leaves something to be desired, theologically speaking, as it appears to mean that not everybody has been redeemed by the blood of Christ'. This has led to various corrections: omnes qui has been corrected into omnes (P and VIII 34:24 K) or omnes illi (VIII 34:24 Y); non rependunt Deo dileccionem has been corrected into qui tamen omnes non rependunt Deo dileccionem P (deo om.) and VIII 34:24 K. IV 105:1 mittam eis] mittam regibus Francie et Anglie F et VIII 28:1 The oldest version of the text of these ten Revelations is therefore clearly that handed down by the manuscripts of the p group, chiefly V and Y, since, as we have seen, P and BOAb in certain instances have adopted readings also to be found in the Book VIII tradition. K2 and F to an even greater extent contain wordings that have probably been imported from Book VIII. Gh, finally, is a special case, as the text of these Revelations has been truncated in Book VIII: the fragment remaining obviously belongs to the Book VIII tradition, however. On the other hand, the text given by Gh in the corresponding Revelations of Book IV is the same as that handed down by K2. The full investigation into the relations between the tradition of Books II —VII on the one hand and that of Book VIII on the other must await the publication of the text of Book VIII; since the text of these Revelations is to be published twice, in the same manner as it was written in the [3 group of manusc- ripts, the soundest method to be adopted for the present edition will be to publish the oldest discernible version of the text, leaving the more developed Alfonsine version to be printed in the corresponding Revelations in Book VIII. In Book IV, then, the text published is that of the 13 group of manuscripts. 
 
 
 
 
 3 Textual Criticism 3.1 Principles This edition is intended to present the text of the original Alfonsine version, which is generally identical with that of the archetype reconstructed by means of the Stemma codicum, that is, the text correctly handed down in at least three of the four identifiable branches of the textual tradition, PVY, BOA b, Kux, and Fq. When the wording of a rubric has been in doubt, I have also collated the lists of rubrics to Book IV given by PVY BOAb ux C1. 84 In certain instances, where the correctness of the archetype has been in doubt, I have also turned to sources outside the manuscript tradition of Book IV, such as the medieval retranslation of the Revelations into Old Swedish (Blir, the text of other Revelations and the Acta et processus canonizacionis Sancte Birgitte (A&P). Reference to these sources is given in the Apparatuses. In those cases where no consensus exists between the manuscripts, my main principle has been to adopt the reading that context or sense would suggest to be the more authentic one. In these instances, I have often had reason to consider the reading retained by PVY BOAb as more authentic, whereas that of Kux Fq gives the impression of representing a later revision. One example of this type is Rev. IV 22:3: Diu enim est quod sedes apostolica non placauit (placuit V Ab) Deum PVY BOAb diu enim est quod sedes apostolica placauit Deum Kux Fq Gh: the construction, diu est quod, where quod functions as a temporal adverb ("it is a long time that"), is attested from archaic Latin, but appears later to have been construed as a temporal conjunction ("it is a long time since")86 . In the former case, the negation (non placauit) is necessary, in the latter, it is superfluous. The choice between the two readings is not obvious, but the reading of PVY BOAb appears to be the more difficult one, inviting a scribe to delete the negation before the verb. The construction, diu est quod, is attested also in Rev. VII 22:1: Filia mea, diu est quod ego promiseram tibi in Roma, quod ostenderem tibi modum partus mei. Here, quod undoubtedly functions as a No list rubrics are given in K or F. For a discussion of the use of these rubrics in the Revelations editions already printed, see BEROR (1967:89ff.) and UNDIIAGEN (1978:226) 85 Cf. ÖBERG (1986:68ff.) 86 Cf. LÖFSTEDT (1911:56f.) and SZANTYR (1965:580f.). 
 
 
 
 
 49 temporal conjunction. Hence it is even more probable that the n reading of IV 22:3 is an attempt at normalising the text; the contrary assumption — that the p scribe has attempted to correct the text by adding non — is therefore less tenable. Cf. also VI 6:4: Cum enim ab aliquo ad fram prouocata fueris, vsquequo ira ab animo semota non fuerit, non loquaris ei ...: non ante fuerit om. 0 F Gh del. q87. This passage illustrates how a misunderstood negation may be deleted to facilitate understanding. The archetype's usquequo ira semota non fuerit "as long as your wrath shall not have been removed from your soul" is no less correct Latin than the text of 0 F and Gh, "until your wrath shall have been removed from your soul". IV 53:6 virginitas viduitas et coniugium VY BOAb virginitatis viduitatis et coniugium P virginitatis viduitatis et coniugum q virginitatis viduitatis et coniugii Kux F Gh. The genitivus explicativus is the more correct reading, grammatically speaking, and would be less liable to correction by scribes; hence, the reading of VY BOAb has the greater air of authority. As mentioned above (ch. 2.1.3), in a certain number of instances the best reading appears to be found in a smaller body of manuscripts, namely VY. Thanks to their close connection with the monastery of San Girolamo di Quarto where Alfonso of JaU spent his last few years, the two latter have retained by interpolation or correction a greater number of authentic readings than the other manuscripts of their branch of the tradition. Instances where I have considered the reading of VY superior to that or those of the rest of the tradition are: IV 4:26 turri VY turrim BOAb K2 Gh carcerem P: turri is also the reading of Y and K in VIII 13:26 IV 11:11 fecisti monti tuo cohabitare VY2 fecisti monti tuo P fecisti monti tuo habitare B monti tuo fecisti habitare 0 fecisti in monte tuo habitare post torr. Ab cohabitare fecisti monti tuo Kux Fq cohabitari fecisti monti tuo Gh. Except for VY2, the 13 tradition has lost the prefix co- (P has also lost habitare); in n on the other hand the word order appears to have been adjusted. IV 13:7 dispendia animarum VY dispendia anime P BOAb Kux Fq Gh: cf. IV 12:2 de dispendio animarum and 17:2 dispendium animarum. IV 17:16 viuificabit VY iudicabit P BOAb K2 F Gh: cf 1 Sm. 2,6 and 4 Rg. 5,7. The manuscripts of the 13 group have a long hyperbaton between cuius and auriga (the latter word is omitted by P), the most extreme being found in VY; this apparently gave rise to corrections in the xc manuscripts.  50 IV 53:4 desiderauit VY desiderabat P BOAb Kux Fq Gh. Since all the verbs of this clause are in the perfect tense, desiderabat appears the more likely to be an error. 3.2 Problematical passages IV 3:3 erant in diluuio in archa (in archa del.) Y erant in diluuio PV BOAb q erant in archa noe K2 Gh. Rev. VIII 41:3: post erant in ras. in archa noe scripta vid. Y, in archa noe r. In the Book IV tradition, erant in diluuio appears to have been the reading of the archetype, the reading of K2 Gh being a later, rather obvious correction. The reading of Y, erant in diluuio in archa, is more problematical, as in archa has not been added but has instead been deleted on a later occasion. I have found no instances where the first hand of Y corrects against his source — the corrections are all done by Y2; hence the reading was in all likelihood present in the exemplar of Y. In Book VIII 41:3, the words in archa noe in Y appear to have been written by a different hand, possibly in rasura, whereas r has in archa noe. Since the words in diluuio alone are plainly in error, and the reading of K2 Gh and Book VIII, in archa noe, are a suspected later correction, it is reasonable to assume that the reading retained by Y at the very least represents a more economical and possibly more authoritative correction of the archetype error. IV 21:1 trinus in personis et unus in natura: et unus BOAb x unus u unum PVY K Fq Gh. Cf. Rev. VIII 1:7 Itaque Deus trinus est et unus: trinus in personis, unus in natura. IV 23:4 est factus sanctus V BOAb factus est sanctus q est factus PY (sanctus ante factus in marg. suppl. Y 2) factus est suus ux est factus simulatorie sanctus K factus est F (post quae verba simulatorie sanctus in marg. add. F2) factus est simulatorie sanctus Gh. This passage deals with a person whom the Devil deludes into attemp- ting impossible feats; among other things, he is falsely informed that he has been made completely holy: this statement has been modified in K, F, and Gh by the rather pointless addition of simulatorie. In view of the presence of sanctus in all manuscripts except ux and the conflicting word order of K F, there can be no doubt that factus est sanctus is the reading of the archetype. It is remarkable, however, that the reading of ux, factus est suus (a misunderstood abbreviation, or possibly a "Verschlimmbesserung") is identical with that of BU: "Vtan thässom bär ondir ande vitne at han är allir hans" — "But to him the evil spirit bears witness that he is altogether his". IV 24:1 dolium vini BOAb Kux Fq Gh dolium vini vel ceruisie PVY. I have followed the wording of the archetype, as the words vel ceruisie could easily have been supplemented by PVY from §2. The Latin text of the three first sections of this Revelation is much wordier than the Old Swedish text, and it is quite possible that the latter, which at this point only mentions "ölkar" ("a vat of ale") represents 
 
 
 
 
 51 a version doser to Birgitta's original text. In the latter part of the Revelation (sections 4-8) it is, on the other hand, the Latin version that gives the greater impression of authority.88 IV 24:2 minuendum: cf. Atu (1986, note 16). IV 32:8 trinus et F deus et q et deus Ua om. K Gh. Cf. IV 21:1 above. IV 33:18 et tolate] et colate u in colate x. I have interpreted tolate, clearly handed down from the archetype, as a false reading of collate8 9, the perfect participle of confero, and more or less synonymous with the preceding arte'. This interpretation also agrees with that of BU ad loc.: "Ok thera ärma äru nu thranga oc kröpada" ("And their sleeves are now tight and shrunk"). IV 60:2 tribulatus dicit ima pag. suppl. K2 om. codd. Gh. A necessary addition, given by K2. IV 102:22 In this dialogue between the Judge and the Devil we should expect the Devil's arguments in the beginning of §22 to be answered by the Judge at the end of the same section. Since no reply is to be found, we must suspect that a passage of the original text has been lost in transmission. The wording of Kux qUa is Et Ethiops: Tu, inquit, dixisti). F (Gh) offers a correction by inserting addidit after Ethiops ("And the negro added"). In BU (II, 192, 20-25), the problematical passage has instead been condensed into "swa som thu sagdhe" — "just as you said". Since the text offered by the majority of the manuscripts is obviously defective, and F (Gh) and BU offer individual corrections to this problem, we may conclude that the text was corrupt already in the archetype. IV 126:34 propterea quod V propterea qui PY BOAb Kux Fq Gh: the subject of the entire clause (in §33), illud quod trahitur, is in the neuter, as is evident also in §34, donet trahibile et delectabile fiat. Hence, whether by direct influence from Alfonso's original or by correction, V alone has the correct reading. IV 136:R Clementem VI x q Clementem V Ku F om. Gh. Clement V (1305-1314) could not possibly have been the recipient of Revelations by St. Birgitta, whereas Clement VI (1342-1352) held office at the time of Birgitta's peregrination to Santiago de Compostela (1341-1343), when she passed through France. In Rev. IV 136:0 it is expressly said that the Revelation is directed to the Pope per duos annos ante iubileum, that is in 1348 or 1349.9' Alu (1986:76ff.) " Cf. Lath., tollatus (1290), considered as a false reading of collatus. The correct dress of young noblemen in love, among other things consisted in lacing up his sleeves, as is described by TUCIIMAN (1979:193f.), quoting Le roman de la rose, vv. 2153ff. (ed. LECOY, 1965:67: the italics are mine): Ne sueffre sus toi nul'ordure lave tes mains, tes denz escure; s'en tes ongles pert point de noir, ne lesse point remanoir. Cous tes manches, tes cheveus pigne mes ne te fardes ne ne guignes 91 For the expression per duos annos meaning "two years", cf. BERGII (1966). 
 
 
 
 
 52 3.3 Emendations In emending the text I have followed a very restrictive policy, preferring in many, if not most, cases to comment upon difficult passages in the Apparatus criticus, sometimes suggesting a better reading by the word exspectes. In the main, my emendations concern minor errors, readily explained as paleo- graphical mistakes or slips of the pen. In the following instances, I have considered the textual tradition corrupt and have added or deleted a word or changed the word order of the archetype. Among the emendations I have also counted those in- stances where I have adopted the reading given by a source outside the manuscript tradition, such as BU. IV 2:3 cuius os scripsi os codd. Gh IV 15:28 post moriturus addidi et om. codd. Gh IV 16:26 eiusmodi exclusi auctore BU ad loc., habent PVY BOAb ux q ex eiusdemmodi torr. F eiusdem K huiusmodi Gh IV 17:19 subiturus scripsi facturus codd. Gh et VIII 14:19. I have corrected the text, which appears to be an archetype error, on the strength of the wording of IV 17:22: ne grauius iudicium subeam. BU (III, 329, 28) corrects the text, by assuming racionem in place of iudicium, into: "fore gudz dom görande rekinskap aff allo mik andwordhadho" — "Before God's judgement giving a reckoning of all that had been entrusted to me." IV 136:0 sexto scripsi quinto Ku Fq om. x deest Gh Rev. VI:63 ed. BERGH. Cf. note above (sect. 3.2) on 136:R. IV 142:14 fortitudine scripsi fortitudinem codd. Gh: the passive voice of induo is usually constructed with the ablative in the Revelations92; cf. IV 6:9 induentur confusione, and RS 124 cum autem induitur cuculla. Another construction of the sentence under discussion, consurge viriliter induere fortitudinem confidenter, whe- re induere is regarded as an infinitivus finalis, appears less likely, since this con- struction cannot be found at all in the Revelations. 92 1 am much indebted to Prof. BERGH, who pointed out this usage to me. 
 
 
 
 
 4 Principles of Edition The orthography of the text published in this volume follows in most details that of Codex Kalmarnensis; the orthography of the manuscripts not being homogeneous, it appeared to me problematical to normalise the spelling throughout. The Codex Kalmarnensis, on the other hand, is one of the oldest surviving Vadstena manusc- ripts of the Revelaciones and therefore represents the orthography practised in the mother foundation of the Birgittine order at the end of the 14th century. The Codex Falkenberg is probably older than the Codex Kalmarnensis; however, it lacks a sizeable portion of the text through the loss of an entire quire, and it would have been necessary to reconstruct its orthography in this part. I therefore consider that by my accepting the main traits of the orthography of K, my edition may indeed perhaps be considered to have preserved a certain flavour of Vadstena Abbey that would be absent in a strictly normalised text. In two cases, however, 1 have diverged from the usage of K: by printing vocalic u (not v, which dominates in K) and by printing membrum, not menbrum, although the latter spelling is marginally more common in the rather small number of cases where K has written this word out in full. These rules I have applied even to those portions of the text absent in K or written by K2 at the end of the codex. The orthographical rules of the first hand of K and those of K2 are not fully identical, however; the main divergences being that where K writes abundo, loqutus, and obtineo, K2 writes habundo, locutus, and optineo. The manuscripts used for this edition exhibit a very great number of errors and variant readings, not all of which are relevant for an understanding of the history of the text. In order to restrict the size of the apparatus criticus for the main body of the text, namely Rev. IV 1-130 (excluding the Add., Decl. , and the geminated Revelations) I therefore only report a selection of the readings, using the following principles. 1. In the main text of Rev. IV 1-130, I report the most important individual readings of those manuscripts which I judge crucial to an understanding of the tradition, namely P, V and Y. 2. The readings of the two manuscripts originating in the scriptorium of Vadstena Abbey, namely F and K, may have a significant part to play in a future project of 
 
 
 
 
 54 producing a new edition of the Old Swedish version of the Reuelaciones, Birgittas uppenbarelser (BU); I therefore also report the most important of their readings. 3. The Editio princeps, Gh, has been used as the basic edition of the Reuelaciones for so long that its readings, whether erroneous or correct, are widely quoted as if they constituted the canonical text of the Reuelaciones. I therefore consider it important to give modern readers the opportunity of comparing the readings of Gh with those of the manuscript tradition, and consequently I also report most rea- dings of this edition. 4. The readings of the remaining manuscripts collated for this edition are repor- ted only when they are present in an entire group: in the apparatus criticus, the individual readings of B, 0, Ab, q, u, and x are thus generally only reported when shared by other manuscripts. I have made an exception to this rule in the case of very long omissions of text, since these may be helpful in establishing the relation- ships and textual worth of any newly discovered manuscripts93. In those portions of the text retained only by a few manuscripts, namely the Add., Decl., geminated Revelations, and Rev. IV 131-144, I generally report the variant readings and errors of all manuscripts collated. As in the editions published by HOLLMAN, BERGH, EKLUND, and UNDHAGEN, the text has been subdivided into sections. The subdivisions used in the Ghotan edition — capital letters inserted into the text — are given in the margin. While these editions generally refer to passages of the text by page numbers, chapters and lines, I have made chapters and sections the basis of all references in the Apparatus fontium and Apparatus criticus as well as in the Introduction and Indexes94. This has perforce led to a certain wordiness in the apparatus, as my ambition has been at all costs to avoid ambiguity. In the apparatus criticus, the lemma, if given to clarify the reference, is the subject of all comments; when no lemma is given, the subject is generally obvious. Thus, in IV 127:16 abieccionem] deieccionem K2 post torr. q, the latter manuscript, after correcting the text, reads abieccionem. Besides u, which was virtually unknown to Birgitta scholars, until it was found by Prof. EKLUND and (later) by myself, a hitherto unknown Revelations manuscript was discovered in 1985. A description, in the form of a letter from Dr. M. MAIROLD, Graz, to Dr. U. MONTAG, Miinchen, was circulated in 1985 through the good services of Dr. T. NYBERG, Odense. This manuscript, which has as yet not been assigned a siglum, is: (Dependance der Grazer Zentralbibliothek in) Giissing, Bibliothek der Fran- ziskaner, a. 1445. By collating a microfilm copy of this manuscript, I have found its text to be closely related to that of Ab. 94 The same policy has been adopted by BERGH in his edition of Book VI. 93

 64 D E LIBRI QVARTI CAP. 2 21 Qui vero voluerit michi presentare piscem, vadat ad litus habendo rete in manibus, quod contextum sit non de filis set de ere preciosissimo. 22 Ingrediatur itaque aquam set non plus quam ad genua, ne forte noceant procelle, et pedem in illo loco figat, ubi solidum est et arena absque luto. 23 Deinde excecat sibi unum oculum, quem excecatum vertat ad piscem, cuius visus, qui est quasi basilisci, nullo modo tunc aduersus hominem preualebit. 24 Sumat quoque clipeum de calibe in brachium suum; tunc non nocebit sibi morsus serpentinus. Postea extendat rete suum super piscem ita valide et caute, quod piscis rasoriis suis non valeat discindere rete vel rumpere nec euadere aliqua fortitudine vel impulsu. 25 Si itaque sentit piscem, extendat rete super eum sursum; quem si decem horis tenuerit super aquas, tunc piscis ille morietur. Quem portans ad litus respiciat eum oculo illo quem non excecauerat et apponendo manus aperiat eum in dorso, ubi plus est de sanguine, et sic presentet eum domino suo. 26 Si vero piscis euaserit aut natauerit ad litus aliud nocens homini veneno suo, ego potens sum sanare infectum, nec minor erit remuneracio pro sanguine piscis quam pro corde animalis." 27 Item loquitur Deus: "Statere iste significant tantum, quasi quis diceret: 'Parce et patere, expecta et miserere,' quasi aliquis videns iniusticiam alterius et semper, ut a malo desisteret, eum ammoneret. 28 Sic ego Deus et creator omnium quandoque more statere descendo ad hominem ammonendo eum, parcendo ei et tribulacionibus eum probando; quandoque ascendo mentes hominum illustrando, inflammando graciaque insolita visitando. 29 Ligature ere] ere purissimo et ux 21 presentare michi K Fq Gh contextum] textum P in illo loco figat pedem ux Fq 22 ingrediatur itaque] ingrediaturque ux unum] 23 excecet Kux Fq Gh Gh figat] fugat V pedem om.  LIBRI QVARTI CAP. 2-3 65 vero statere ascendentes nubes significant, quod ego omnium Deus omnes, tam gentiles quam Christianos, tam amicos quam inimicos sustento et gracia mea illustro et visito, si tamen inuenirentur qui gracie mee respondere vellent, voluntatem et affectum suum a malo auertendo. 30 Animal vero significat illos qui sanctum baptisma susceperunt, et peruenientes ad annos discrecionis set verba sancti euangelii non imitantes, quorum cor et os ad terrena prolapsum est, spiritualia minime attendunt. 31 Piscis vero significat gentiles in procellis concupiscencie vagantes, quorum sanguis id est fides modica est et intellectus ad Deum paruus. 32 Ideo desidero et cor animalis et sanguinem piscis, si tamen inuenirentur qui ex caritate conarentur michi illa presentare. 33 Tres vero turbe sunt amici mei: primi qui mundo utuntur racionabiliter, secundi qui sua relinquunt obediendo humiliter, tercii qui mori pro Deo parati sunt."  66 B LIBRI QVARTI CAP. 3 est aliquid acquisitum contra iusticiam. 2 Nunc autem rex iste habet terram, quam quidam dicunt habere eum ex iusticia, alii respondent contrarium. Et ideo mirum est, si in isto hoc toleras, quod in aliis reprobatur." 3 Respondit Deus: "Post diluuium nulli homines remanserunt nisi qui erant in diluuio in archa; et ex eis una progenies nata est, que venit ad orientem, de qua eciam quidam venerunt in Sweciam. 4 Et alia generacio venit ad occidentem, de qua quidam exorti venerunt in Daciam. Set qui primum ceperunt colere terram non circumuallatam aqua, nichil appropriabant sibi de terra eorum qui habitabant ultra aquas et in insulis, 5 set unusquisque contentabatur de eo quod inuenerat, sicut scriptum est de Loth et Abraham: 'Si,' inquit, 'tu ad dexteram vadis, ego sinistram tenebo,' quasi diceret: `Quidquid tu tibi approprias, hoc erit tuum et heredum tuorum.' 6 Deinde proce- dente tempore venerunt iudices et reges, qui contenti terminis suis non occupabant terram eorum, qui in insulis et ultra aquam habita- bant, set stabat unusquisque in terminis et limitibus antiquorum." 7 Respondit illa: "Quid si pars aliqua regni donacione aliqua alienaretur a regno, numquid a successore non repetendum esset?" 8 Cui Deus: "In regno quodam," inquit, "seruabatur corona pertinens ad regem. Iste rex habet duos fillos et duo regna. In altero regno eligitur rex iure hereditario, in altero secundum fauorem populi. 24 Nunc autem contrarium factum est: nam filius iunior assumptus est in regnum hereditarium, maior vero in regnum quod per eleccionem debetur." 25 Respondit Deus: "In electoribus eorum tria erant inconueniencia et quartum superexcellit: inordinatus amor, prudencia simulata, adulacio stultorum et diffidencia de Deo et communitate. 26 Ideo eleccio eorum fuit contra iusticiam, contra Deum, contra bonum rei publice et utilitatem communitatis. 27 Propterea ad prouidendum paci et consulendum utilitati communitatis necesse est, quod senior filius recipiat regnum hereditarium, iunior vero ad eleccionem veniat. 28 Alioquin, nisi retractentur priora facta, regnum pacietur dispendium, communitas affligetur, discordia orietur, dies filiorum erunt in amaritudine, 29 regnaque eorum iam non erunt regna set sicut scriptum est: 'Potentes transmigrabunt a sedibus suis, et qui ambulabant in terris eleuabuntur.' 30 Ecce dico tibi exemplum de duobus regnis; in uno est eleccio, in alio est hereditas.  LIBRI QVARTI CAP. 3-4 69 eligencium et cupiditas ambientis regnum. 31 Ergo Deus non affligit filium pro peccatis patris nec in eternum irascitur, set iusticiam facit et seruat in terris et in celis. 32 Ideo regnum illud non veniet ad priorem gloriam et feliciorem statum, donec verus heres consurget aut ex paterna successione aut materna." Verba Dei ad sponsam de duobus spiritibus, scilicet bono et malo; et de mirabili et utili bello in mente cuiusdam domine orto ab inspiracionibus boni spiritus et a temptacionibus maligni spiritus; et quid in istis sit eligendum. Spiritus malus suadet diligere que videt, leuigat peccata, allegat infirmitates, proponit exempla infirmorum. 3 Ecce dico tibi exemplum, quomodo uterque spiritus inflammat cor illius domine tibi note. Nos sumus homines infirmi, Christus vero Deus et homo. Non debemus equiparare opera nostra ad opera sanctorum, quibus et maior gracia et familiaritas erat cum Deo. 16 Sufficiat nobis sperare celum et iuxta infirmitatem nostram viuere et peccata nostra elemosinis et oracionibus redimere. Puerile namque est et insipiencium insolita assumere, et ea non posse consumare.' 17 Iterum respondit bona infusio: Indigna sum,' inquit, `assimilari sanctis, set tamen tutum est valde conari ad perfeccionem paulatim. Quid namque obest aggredi insolita? Potens enim est Deus dare adiutorium. 18 Sepe autem contingit, quod viam domini potentis et diuitis sequitur pauper aliquis. Et licet dominus cicius peruenerit ad hospicium delicatisque cibis fruitur et in molli quiescit lecto, 19 pauper tamen ad idem hospicium peruenit, licet tarde, et tamen ibidem reliquiis ciborum domini participatur; qui, nisi viam domini secutus fuisset hospiciumque domini requisisset, cibis domini usus non fuisset. 20 Sic et ego dico nunc, quod quamuis indigna sim similari sanctis, tamen volo aggredi viam post eos, ut saltim possim participari meritis eorum. 21 Nam duo sunt que sollicitant me in animo: primo quod si D mansero in patria, superbia dominatur michi, amor parentum, qui iuuari petunt, deprimit mentem meam, superfluitas familie et vestium est michi onerosa. 22 Ideo delectat me et consulcius est descendere de sede superbie et peregrinando humiliare corpus meum quam manere in honoris statu et peccata peccatis accumulare. 23 Secundo sollicitat me paupertas populi et eorum clamor, quem, ubi iuuare deberem, cotidie presencia mea grauo.  72 E LIBRI QVARTI CAP. 4 24 Respondit mala infusio: `Peregrinari,' inquit, 'non est nisi in- constantis animi, cum misericordia est accepcior omni sacrificio. 25 Si enim recedis de patria, cupidi homines audita fama tua spoliabunt et capient te; et tunc pro libertate sencies captiuitatem, pro diuiciis paupertatem, pro honore dedecus, pro quiete tribulacionem.' 26 Respondit iterum inspirando spiritus bonus: `Audiui,' inquit, `quen- dam captiuum positum in turri, qui maiorem consolacionem habuit in captiuitate et tenebris quam unquam prius habuit in abundancia et consolacione temporali. 27 Ideo, si placet Deo me tribulari, erit michi in maius meritum. Ipse enim pius est ad consolandum et promptus ad subueniendum, maxime si non egredior de patria nisi propter peccata mea et ad promerendam diuinam caritatem.' 28 Respondit iterum mala infusio: 'Quid,' inquit, 'si indigna fueris consolacione diuina et fueris impaciens ad paupertatem et humilitatem? 29 Tunc enim penitebit te assumpsisse rigorem; tunc habebis baculum in manibus pro annulo, panniculum in capite pro corona et vilem saccum pro purpureo indumento.' 30 Respondit iterum bonus spiritus: inquit, `quod sancta Elizabeth, filia regis Vngarie, delicate enutrita et nobiliter nupta magnam sustinuit paupertatem et deieccionem. 31 Que maiorem consolacionem obtinuit in paupertate a Deo et sublimiorem coronam, quam si mansisset in omni honore mundi et eius consolacione.' 32 Iterum respondit mala inspiracio: 'Quid,' inquit, 'facies, si tradiderit te Deus in manus hominum fuerisque violata in corpore?  LIBRI QVARTI CAP. 4 73 33 Numquid pre pudore subsistere poteris? Numquid non inconsola- biliter dolebis de pertinacia tua, totaque generacio tua scandalizata lugebit? 34 Tunc certe consurget tibi impaciencia, tunc anxietas in corde et ingratitudo ad Deum. Tunc optabis finiri dies tuos; et cum in ore omnium fueris diffamata, numquid audebis apparere?' 35 Iterum respondit bona cogitacio: Audiui ex scriptura, quod virgo beata Lucia, ducta ad lupanar, constans in fide et confidens de bonitate Dei dixit: "Quantumcumque vexatur corpus meum, nichilominus virgo sum, et duplicabitur michi corona." 36 Cuius fidem respiciens Deus seruauit eam illesam. Sic ego dico: Deus, qui neminem permittit temptari supra vires, custodiat animum meum, fidem et voluntatem meam. Ego enim totam me ei committo; fiat eius voluntas de me.' 37 Ergo, quia domina illa hiis pulsatur cogitacionibus, ideo admoneo eam de tribus. Primo, quod reducat ad memoriam, ad qualem honorem est electa; secundo, qualem caritatem Deus ei in coniugio suo ostenderat; tercio, quam benigne in hac mortalitate est seruata. 38 Iterum incauto eam de tribus. Primo, quod racionem redditura est Deo de omnibus bonis suis temporalibus, adhuc eciam de quolibet obulo, quomodo scilicet leuatus est et erogatus; 39 secundo, quod tempus suum valde est breue, et nesciet antequam cadat; tercio, quod Deus non parcit plus domine quam ancille. 40 Ideo consulo ei tria. Primo penitere de commissis, emendare fructuose confessa, Deum diligere toto corde. Secundo consulo fugere racionabiliter penam purgatorii. 41 Sicut enim qui non diligit Deum toto corde dignus est magno supplicio, sic qui non emendat peccata, cum potest, dignus est purgatorio. 42 Tercio consulo dimittere amicos carnales ad tempus propter Deum et venire ad 35 virgo beata Lucia, ducta ad lupanar, constans in fide et confidens de bonitate Dei dixit: "Quantumcumque vexatur corpus meum, nichilominus virgo sum, et duplicabitur michi 36 Deus, qui neminem permittit temptari supra corona": Fsv. leg. 1, p. 556 f. vires: lac. 1,13. 35 ducta] numquid] numquam BOA' finire K2 34 tibi consurget K2 37 ei deus me ei totam V 36 custodiet Ab Gh ducta fuit V 41 magno supplicio] inferno K2 39 nesciat V K2 40 penite K2 P F 
 
 
 
 
 74 LIBRI QVARTI CAP. 4-5 locum, ubi compendium est inter celum et mortem ad fugiendam penam purgatorii, 43 quia ibi sunt indulgencie, que sunt eleuaciones et redempciones animarum, quas sancti pontifices dederunt et sancti Dei sanguine suo promeruerunt." Verba beati Petri ad sponsam de desiderio quod habuit ad saluandas gentes; et qualiter informat sponsam ad memoriam obtinendam et de magnis mirabilibus, que adhuc in urbe Romana debent adimpleri vel compleri. Capitulum V. A 1 Beatus Petrus loquitur sponse Christi: "Tu, filia, comparasti me aratro, quod facit sulcos latos et extirpat radices. Hoc utique verum fuit. 2 Nam sic feruens contra vicia fui et ad mores accensus quod, si totum mundum potuissem ad Deum conuertisse, nullatenus pepercissem vite mee nec labori. 3 Ipse quippe Deus dulcis michi fuit in cogitatu, dulcis in loqucione, dulcis in operacione, in tantum quod omnia erant michi amara ad cogitandum preter Deum. Attamen ipse Deus eciam michi amarus fuit, non ex se set ex me ipso. 4 Nam quociens cogitabam, quantum deliqui et quomodo eum negaueram, fleui amare, quia noueram iam perfecte amare et fuerunt michi lacrime mee delectabiles tamquam cibus dulcis. 5 Quod vero rogas me dare tibi memoriam, respondeo tibi: Numquid non audisti, quam obliuiosus ego fui?  76 LIBRI QVARTI CAP. 6 Narracio optima beati Pauli ad sponsam, qualiter precibus beati Stephani fuerit a Deo vocatus et de lupo agnus effectus; et qualiter est bonum orare pro omnibus. Capitulum VI. 1 Loquitur beatus Paulus sponse Christi dicens: "Tu, filia, comparasti me leoni, qui inter lupos nutritus fuerat, set de lupis mirabiliter ereptus est. Vere, filia, lupus rapax ego eram, set de lupo fecit me Deus agnum; et hoc propter duo. 2 Primo propter magnam suam caritatem, qui de indignis facit vasa sua et de peccatoribus amicos suos. Secundo propter preces beati Stephani protomartiris. 3 Nam ostendere tibi volo, quomodo et in qua intencione tunc fui, quando lapidatus fuit Stephanus, et quare merui preces eius. 4 Ego quippe non gaudebam nec delectabar de pena beati Stephani nec inuidebam glorie eius, set tamen cupiebam eum morf, eo quod iuxta intencionem meam non videbam ipsum habere fidem veram. 5 Cumque viderem eum ultra modum feruentem et pacientem ad pas- sionem ferendam, vehementer dolui ipsum esse infidelem, cum reue- ra ipse esset fidelissimus et ego totus cecus et infidelis. 6 Et compa- ciendo ei rogaui orando ex toto corde, quod pena sua amara pro- ficeret ei ad gloriam et coronam. 7 Propterea cumprimis profecit michi oracio eius, quia per oracio- nem ipsius de multis lupis ereptus sum et factus mansuetus agnus. Ideo bonum est orare pro omnibus, quia illis proficit oracio iusti, qui propinquiores et apciores sunt ad recipiendum graciam. 8 Set nunc conqueror, quod vir iste tam eloquens inter doctores et tam paciens inter lapidantes nimis oblitus et neglectus est a cordibus multorum et maxime ab hiis, qui ei nocte ac die tenerentur assistere. 9 Hii enim Cap.  LIBRI QVARTI CAP. 6-7 77 portant ei vasa sua confracta et vacua, lutosa et abhominabilia. Ideo sicut scriptum est, induentur `confusione duplici et rubore' et eicien- tur a domibus voluptatis." Visio mirabilis et notanda de quadam anima iudicanda et de Dyaboli accusacionibus et virginis gloriose aduocacionibus et de exposicione ip- sius visionis, in qua celum per palacium, Christus per solem, virgo per mulierem, Dyabolus per Ethiopem, angelus per militem designantur; et in qua duo loca penarum irremediabilia et tria remediabilia computantur et multa alla mirabilia et quam maxime de suffragiis. Capitulum VII. 1 Vni persone vigilanti in oracione et non dormienti videbatur in spirituali visione, quasi videret palacium incomprehensibile magnitudine, in quo erant innumerabiles vestiti vestibus albis et fulgidis, quorum quilibet videbatur habere sedem propriam. 2 In palacio vero principaliter stabat una sedes iudiciaria, in qua erat quasi sol; et splendor qui de sole procedebat erat incomprehensibilis in longitudine, profunditate et latitudine. 3 Virgo quoque una stabat iuxta sedem habens preciosam coronam in capite, omnesque seruiebant soli sedenti in sede, laudantes eum in hympnis et canticis. 4 Deinde videbatur quidam Ethiops, terribilis in aspectu et gestibus, quasi plenus inuidia et accensus ira magna, qui loquendo clamauit: "0, iuste iudex, iudica michi animam et audi opera eius! Modicum enim iam restat de vita eius. Permitte quoque michi punire corpus cum anima, donec abinuicem separentur." 5 Quibus dictis 9 induentur confusione duplici et rubore: Is 61,7. 9 sicut] sic BAb R visionis om. ux in marg. suppl. Cap.  78 B LIBRI QVARTI CAP. 7 videbatur michi quod unus stabat coram sede quasi miles armatus, pudicus et sapiens in verbis modestusque in gestibus suis, qui dixit: "0, iudex, ecce hic sunt bona opera eius, que gessit usque ad hanc horam." 6 Et statim audiebatur vox de sole sedente in sede: "Hic," inquit, "vicium maius est quam virtus, nec est iusticia quod vicium summe virtuti coniungatur." 7 Respondit Ethiops: "Ergo," inquit, "iusticia est ut anima ista coniungatur michi. Si enim ipsa vicium aliquod habet in se, sic et in me nequicia est omnis." 8 Respondit miles: "Misericordia Dei quamlibet personam sequitur usque ad mortem et usque ad ultimum punctum et postea fit iudicium. In isto vero homine, de quo loquimur, adhuc coniuncta sunt anima et corpus et discrecio manet in eo." 9 Respondit Ethiops: "Scriptura dicit, que mentiri non potest: `Diliges Deum super omnia et proximum tuum sicut te ipsum'. Vide ergo, quod omnia opera istius facta sunt ex timore non ex caritate, sicut debuit, 10 omniaque peccata eius, de quibus confessus est, inuenies confessa cum modica contricione. Ideo promeruit infernum, quia demeruit regnum celorum, et ideo peccata eius sunt hic manifesta apud iusticiam diuinam, 11 quia nunquam adhuc obtinuit contricionem ex diuina caritate peccatorum suorum commissorum." Respondit miles: "Ipse utique sperauit et credidit obtinere contricionem veram ante mortem." 12 Cui Ethiops: "Tu," inquit, "congregasti omnia, quecumque bene fecit, omniaque verba et cogitatus ad salutem anime eius nosti. Sic et tua oracione placatur Deus ad misericordiam cum caritate." 34 Post hec audita est vox de sole dicens: "Propter preces amicorum meorum obtinebit iam ille diuinam contricionem ante mortem, in tantum quod non veniat in infernum, set purgabitur cum illis qui grauiorem penam habent in purgatorio. 35 Purgata vero anima mer- cedem habebit in cells cum illis qui in terris fidem et spem habuerunt cum minima caritate." Quibus dictis demones fugierunt. 36 Deinde sponse videbatur quod quasi locus quidam terribilis et tenebrosus aperiebatur, in quo apparuit fornax ardens intus. Et ignis ille nichil aliud habebat ad comburendum nisi demones et viuentes animas. 37 Supra vero fornacem istam apparuit anima illa, cuius iudicium iam in superioribus auditum est. Pedes vero anime affixi fuerunt fornaci, et anima stabat erecta quasi persona una. 38 Non autem stabat in altissimo loco nec in infimo, set quasi in latere fornacis, cuius forma erat terribilis et mirabilis. Ignis vero fornacis videbatur se trahere sursum infra pedes anime, 39 sicut quando aqua trahit se sursum per fistulas, et violenter comprimendo se ascendebat super caput, in tantum quod pori stabant sicut vene currentes cum ardenti igne. 40 Aures autem videbantur quasi sufflatoria fusorum, que cerebrum totum cum continuo flatu commouebant.  82 G LIBRI QVARTI CAP. 7 affixi. 41 Os quoque erat apertum et lingua extracta per aperturas narium et dependebat ad labia. Dentes autem erant quasi claui ferrei affixi per palatum. Brachia vero ita longa erant, quod tendebant ad pedes. 42 Manus quoque ambe videbantur habere et comprimere quandam pinguedinem cum ardenti pice. Cutis vero, que apparebat supra animam, videbatur habere formam pellis supra corpus et erat quasi linthea vestis circumfusa spermate. 43 Que quidem vestis sic erat frigida, quod omnis qui videhat eam contremuit, et de illa procedebat sicut sanies de ulcere cum corrupto sanguine et fetor ita malus, quod nulli pessimo fetori in mundo posset assimilari. 44 Visa itaque ista tribulacione audiebatur vox de illa anima, que dixit quinque vicibus ve ve, clamans cum lacrimis totis viribus suis. 45 "Primo," inquit, "ve michi, quia sic modicum dilexi Deum pro maximis virtutibus eius et gracia michi data. Secundo ve michi, quia non timui iusticiam Dei, sicut debui. 46 Tercio ve michi, quia dilexi corporis et carnis mee peccatricis voluptatem. Quarto ve michi propter mundi diuicias et superbiam meam. Quinto ve michi, quia unquam vidi vos, Lodouicum et Iohannam." 47 Et tunc dixit angelus michi: "Ego," inquit, "volo tibi exponere visionem istam. Palacium istud quod vidisti est similitudo coli. Multitudo vero illorum qui erant in sedibus vestiti vestibus albis et fulgidis sunt angeli et sanctorum anime. 48 Sol vero significat Christum in deitate sua; mulier autem virginem, que Deum genuit; Ethiops vero Dyabolum, qui animam accusat; miles angelum, qui hona opera anime dicit illi. 49 Fornax vero notat infernum, qui est intus sic ardens, quod si totus mundus arderet cum omnibus que in eo sunt, non esset simile magnitudini fornacis illius. 50 In isto vero fornace audiuntur voces diuerse, omnes loquentes contra Deum omnesque inchoantes voces suas cum ve et similiter finientes.  LIBRI QVARTI CAP. 7 83 51 Scito eciam, quod ignis, qui videbatur tibi in fornace, ardet in eternis tenebris, et anime in eo ardentes non habent omnes equalem penam. 52 Tenebre vero, que apparuerunt in circuitu fornacis, H vocatur limbus et procedit de tenebris, que sunt in fornace; et sunt tamen ambo unus locus et unus infernus: quicumque illuc venerit nunquam habebit cum Deo mansfonem. 53 Supra vero tenebras istas est pena maxima purgatorii, quam anime possunt sustinere; et ultra locum istum est locus alius, ubi minor est pena, que non est alia nisi defectus virium in fortitudine et pulchritudine et consimilibus, 54 sicut per simile dico, quasi si aliquis esset infirmus et cessante infirmitate vel pena nichil haberet de viribus, donec paulatim recuperaret. 55 Tercius vero locus superior est, ubi nulla alia pena est nisi desiderium perueniendi ad Deum. Et ut melius in consciencia tua intelligas, dico tibi per similitudinem, 56 quasi si es misceretur et arderet cum auro in igne ardentissimo, et tam diu deberet depurgari, donec es consumeretur et aurum remaneret purum. 57 Quanto vero es forcius et spissius esset, tanto ardenciori igne indigeret, donec aurum esset quasi aqua currens et totum ardens. 58 Deinde magister eius profert aurum in locum alium, ubi obtineat veram formam in visu et tactu; postea mittit in tercium locum, ubi custodiatur et presentetur possessori. 59 Sic est eciam spiritualiter. In primo loco supra tenebras est i maxima pena purgatorii, ubi vidisti illam supradictam animam purgari. Ibi est demonum tactus; ibi per similitudinem apparent venenosi vermes et similitudo animalium ferocium; 60 ibi calor est et frigus; ibi tenebre et confusio, que procedunt de pena que est in inferno; ibi quedam anime habent minorem penam, quedam maiorem, iuxta quod peccata emendata erant vel non eo tempore, quo anima cum corpore mansit. 52 vocantur V 0 K vocatus x ambe K illic V 53 maxima pena K Gh alius locus Kux Fq 54 si om.  84 K LIBRI QVARTI CAP. 7 61 Deinde magister, id est iusticia Dei, profert aurum, id est animas, in alia loca, ubi non est nisi defectus virium, in quibus anime tam diu morabuntur, 62 donec refrigerium habebunt vel de speciali- bus amicis suis vel de sancte Ecclesie continuis operibus: nam anima, quo maius auxilium habebit de amicis, eo cicius conualescit et libera- bitur de fillo loco. 63 Post hec autem anima fertur in locum tercium, ubi non est pena nisi desiderium perueniendi ad Dei presenciam et eius visionem beatam. 64 In hoc loco morantur multi et nimis diu, preter illos qui, in mundo dum vixerunt, perfectum desiderium ha- buerunt perueniendi ad Dei presenciam et eius visionem. 65 Scito eciam, quod multi moriuntur in mundo ita iusti et innocentes, quod statim perueniunt ad presenciam et visionem Dei, 66 quidam vero peccatis suis cum bonis operibus sic emendatis, quod anime eorum nullam sencient penam; set pauci sunt qui non veniunt in locum ubi est desiderium perueniendi ad Deum. 67 Ideo omnes anime in istis locis tribus morantes participantur sancte Ecclesie precibus et bonis operibus que fiunt in mundo: precipue que fecerunt dum vixerunt et [eorum] que fiunt ab amicis eorum post mortem. 68 Scito eciam, quod sicut peccata sunt multiformia et diuersa, sic eciam pene sunt multiplices et diuerse.  LIBRI QVARTI CAP. 7-8 85 animas oracionibus et bonis operibus laboreque corporis sui, 71 quia iusticia Dei mentiri non potest, que dicit, quod anime aut purgari debent post mortem pena purgatorii aut operibus bonis amicorum cicius solui." 72 Post hec de purgatorio audiebantur multe voces dicentes: "0, L Domine Ihesu Christe, iuste iudex, mitte caritatem tuam hiis qui spiritualiter potestatem habent in mundo; tunc plus participari poterimus quam nunc de eorum cantu, leccione et oblacione." 73 Supra vero spacium istud de quo clamor iste audiebatur, videbatur quasi domus, in qua multe voces audiebantur dicentes: "Merces sit illis a Deo qui mittunt nobis auxilium in defectibus nostris!" 74 In ipsa quoque domo videbatur quasi aurora procedere, subtus vero auroram apparuit nubes, que nichil habebat de luce aurore, de qua vox maxima processit dicens: 75 "0, Domine Deus, da de tua incomprehensibili potestate unicuique centesimam remuneracionem in mundo hiis, qui nos eleuant cum bonis operibus in tue deitatis lucem et tue faciei visionem!"  86 LIBRI QVARTI CAP. 8-9 corporaliter et non ad animam spiritualiter, quia nimis oblitus est et neglexit Deum quamdiu vixit. 3 Ideo nunc anima eius patitur ardorem de igne et contremiscit de frigore; ipsa est ceca de tenebris et de demonum visu horribili timoro- sa, surda de clamore Dyaboli, esuriens et siciens intus et ab extra vestita cum confusione. 4 Attamen Deus dedit ei unam graciam post mortem, quod scilicet non veniret ad tactum demonum. Quia propter solum honorem Dei pepercit et dimisit grauia delicta capitalibus inimicis suis et fecit amiciciam cum capitali inimico suo. 5 Scito eciam, quod quidquid boni fecit et quidquid promisit et dedit de bene acquisitis diuiciis et maxime preces amicorum Dei minuunt et refrigerant penam eius, iuxta quod diffinitum est in iusti- cia Dei. 6 Alia vero bona minus bene acquisita, que dedit, proficiunt hiis spiritualiter qui iuste antea possidebant ea, aut corporaliter, si sint digni iuxta disposicionem Dei."  LIBRI QVARTI CAP. 9 87 scienter mortale peccatum fecit, usque dum ex diuina caritate peni- tuit fructuose — nisi de mundo et amicis Dei auxilium obtineret. 3 Prima itaque etas fuit, quod non dilexit Deum propter nobilis corporis eius mortem et propter tribulaciones eius multiformes, quas et ipse Christus tolerauit, non propter aliam causam nisi propter salutem animarum. 4 Secunda etas fuit, quod non dilexit animam propriam, sicut Christianus debet, nec regraciabatur Deo pro baptis- mo suo et ex eo, quod non erat Iudeus vel paganus. 5 Tercia etas fuit, quod bene sciuit, que Deus precipit facere, et ad hec perficienda modicam habuit voluntatem. 6 Quarta etas fuit, quod bene sciuit, que Deus prohibuit hiis qui ad celum vellent ire, et audacter fecit contra illa, sequens non consciencie sue stimulos set suum carnalem affectum et voluntatem. 7 Quinta etas fuit, quod non usus est gracia et confessione, sicut ad illum pertinebat, cum habuit tam longum tempus. 8 Sexta etas fuit, quod modicum curabat de corpore Christi, nolens illud frequenter recipere, quia a peccato continere noluit nec caritatem habuit recipere corpus Christi antequam in fine vite." 9 Post ista apparuit quidam quasi homo modestus valde in visu, cuius vestes erant albe et fulgide quasi alba sacerdotalis, cinctus zona linea et stola rubea ad collum et subtus brachia eius. 10 Qui inchoabat verba sua isto modo: "Tu, que hec vides, attende et nota et memorie tue commenda, que vides et que dicuntur tibi.  90 B LIBRI QVARTI CAP. 10 creaui meamque maximam caritatem per corporis mei durissimam mortem manifestaui, quam propria voluntate pro animarum salute sustinui. 2 Tres itaque vie sunt, quibus te adire volui, et vere in omnibus eis tu prodere me voluisti. In prima enim via lapidem magnum suspendisti super caput meum, ut me contereret. 3 In se- cunda via acutam lanceam posuisti, que non sineret me ad te proce- dere. In tercia via foueam michi fodisti, ut in eam incaute cadens suffocarer. 4 Set ista que iam dico non corporaliter set spiritualiter debent intelligi. Ego quidem ad habitatores Rome, qui taliter faciunt, loquor set non ad amicos meos, qui eorum opera non sectantur. 5 Prima itaque via, qua venire solitus sum ad cor hominis, est vere timor Dei, super quem homo ingentem suspendit lapidem, 6 hoc est magnam cordis duri presumpcionem, non timens iudicem, cui nemo resistere potest, set ita in corde suo dicens: venerit ad me timor Dei, conteret eum presumpcio cordis mei.' 7 Secunda via, qua venio, est diuini consilii infusio, que eciam multociens aduenit predicacionibus et doctrinis. Tunc nempe in hac via homo lanceam ponit contra me, dum delectabiliter peccat contra precepta mea, 8 proponens firmiter in malis suis perseuerare, donec non poterit ea amplius usitare. Hec certissime est illa lancea que non sinit ad eum venire graciam Dei. 9 Tercia autem via est illuminacio Spiritus sancti in cuiuslibet hominis corde, per quam homo intelligere potest et pensare, que et quanta pro eo feceram et qualia pro ipso passus fueram in me ipso. 10 In hac siquidem via homo profundam michi fodit foueam, sic dicens in corde suo: `Quidquid michi libet, hoc michi sua caritate carius est; 11 sufficit enim michi de hiis, que in hac vita me delectant, cogitare.'  LIBRI QVARTI CAP. 10 91 12 Vere habitatores Rome hec omnia michi faciunt et certissime verbis et operibus hec ostendunt, verba et opera mea pro nichilo reputantes michique et Matri mee ac sanctis meis in ioco et serie, in leticia et ira maledicentes et contumelias pro graciarum accionibus offerentes. 13 Illi quidem non viuunt iuxta consuetudinem Christia- norum, sicut sancta Ecclesia precipit, quia maiorem caritatem non habent ad me quam demones, 14 qui magis miserias suas sustinere volunt eternaliter suamque maliciam retinere quam me videre mi- chique in perhenni gloria adherere. 15 Sic utique sunt illi qui corpus meum nolunt accipere, quod de pane in altari, sicut ego ipse consti- tui, consecratur; cuius percepcio iuuat maxime contra dyabolica temptamenta. 16 0, quam miseri sunt, qui tale iuuamen, dum sani sunt, magis quam venenum respuunt et abhorrent, quia nolunt se a peccatis refrenare! 17 Nunc igitur per unam viam eis incognitam veniam cum potencia c deitatis mee, vindictam mee humanitatis contemptoribus inferendo. 18 Et sicut ipsi michi tria obstacula in viis suis, ne ad ipsos ingrediar, parauerunt, ita et ego alia tria ipsis parabo, quorum amaritudinem viui et mortui sencient et gustabunt. 19 Lapis itaque meus mors est subitanea et improuisa, que sic eos conteret, quod omnia que habent ad iocunditatem suam hic remanebunt et sola anima ad iudicium meum venire compelletur. 20 Lancea vero mea est iusticia mea, que ita eos a me remouebit, quod nunquam gustabunt bonitatem meam, qui eos redetui, et nunquam videbunt pulchritudinem meam, qui eos creaui. 21 Fouea autem mea est inferni tenebrosa obscuritas, in quam ipsi cadent, viuendo ibi in miseria sempiterna.  92 LIBRI QVARTI CAP. 10-11 siue mulieres siue ipsorum filii et filie, qui ad tantam deuenerunt etatem, 23 quod intelligunt Deum omnia peccata vetuisse, et nichilo- minus tamen peccatis se implicant voluntarie, amore Dei excluso eiusque timore paruipenso. 24 Verumptamen talis est michi adhuc voluntas, qualis fuit michi pendenti in cruce. Capitulum XI. Agnes loquitur: "0, Maria, mater et virgo virginum. Tu merito vocari poteris aurora, quam sol verus Ihesus Christus illuminauit. Set numquid voco te auroram propter progeniem regalem aut propter diuicias et honores? 2 Nequaquam. Set merito dicenda es aurora propter humilitatem, propter fidei illuminacionem, propter singulare votum castitatis. Tu enim es veri solis nuncia et productiva, tu iustorum leticia, tu demonum expulsio, tu consolacio peccatorum. 3 Ergo rogo te propter nupcias istas, quas Deus fecit tecum hora ista, ut filia tua stare possit in honore et amore Filii tui."  LIBRI QVARTI CAP. 11 93 4 Respondit Mater Dei: "Quomodo intelligis nupcias istas? Edicito propter istam que hec audit!" Respondit Agnes: "Tu vere utrumque mater et virgo et uxor es. 5 Nam pulcherrime facte sunt in te nupcie hora ista, cum Deus homini in te coniunctus est absque confusione et diminucione deitatis. 6 Virginitas quoque et maternitas sociate sunt illeso virginitatis pudore simulque mater et filia facta es tui creatoris. 7 Illum quippe genuisti hodie temporaliter, qui a Patre eternaliter genitus omnia cum Patre operatus est. Nam Spiritus sanctus fuit in te et extra te et circumquaque tetum; qui fecundauit te consencientem nuncio Dei. 8 Ipseque Filius Dei, qui hodie natus est de te, eciam fuit in te antequam nuncius suus perueniret ad te. Ideo fac misericordiam cum filia tua! 9 Ipsa enim similis est illi paupercule mulieri, que in conualli nichil habebat nisi modicum viuidum, utputa gallinam vel anserem; que ad dominum, qui in monte vallis habitabat, tantum affecta est, quod quidquid habebat viuidum domino in monte ex caritate offerebat. 10 Cui respondit dominus: `Superabundo in omnibus nec tua sunt michi necessaria; set forte ideo parua tribuis, ut tibi maiora tribuantur?' 11 Cui illa: 'Non,' inquit, `hec ideo offero, quia tibi sunt necessaria, set quia me tantillam pauperculam fecisti monti tuo cohabitare a seruisque tuis honorata sum. 12 Ideo tantillum, quod michi tamen est consolatorium, offero tibi, ut probes, quod facerem maiora, si valerem, et ne gratie tue sim ingrata.' 13 Respondit dominus: `Quia me tanta caritate diligis, ego eleuabo te ad montem meum et dabo tibi et tuis vestes et victum annualem.' 14 Sic nunc est filia tua disposita. Ipsa enim illud solum quod habebat viuidum, id est amorem mundi et filiorum reliquit tibi.  94 c LIBRI QVARTI CAP. 11-12 15 Respondit Mater ad sponsam Filii dicens: "Filia, sta stabilis. Ego rogabo Filium meum, qui dabit tibi vittum annualem et collocabit te in monte, ubi milia milium seruiunt angelorum. 16 Nam si computarentur omnes homines, qui nati sunt ab Adam usque ad nouissimum, qui nasciturus est in fine mundi, plus quam decem angeli inueniuntur pro unoquoque homine. 17 Mundus quippe non est nisi quasi quedam olla; ignis vero subtus ollam et cinis sunt amici mundi; set amici Dei sunt quasi optimus cibus in olla. 18 Ergo quando mensa parata fuerit, tunc cibus dulcis presentabitur domino, et delectabitur in eo. 011a vero frangetur, set tamen ignis non extinguetur."  LIBRI QVARTI CAP. 12 95 possunt consolari consolacione temporali, sicut de verbis edificato- riis, de ludo honesto seu de aliis operibus, in quibus nichil detracto- rium sit aut inhonestum, sicut per exemplum intelligere poteris. 4 Si enim pugnus semper teneretur clausus, aut contraherentur nerui aut manus debilitaretur. Sic est eciam in spiritualibus. Si enim animus staret semper in contemplacione, aut obliuiscens seipsum euanesceret superbia, aut minueretur corona glorie sue. 5 Ideo amici Dei quandoque consolantur Spiritus sancti infusione, quandoque tribulantur Dei permissione, quia per tribulaciones extirpantur ra- dices peccatorum et fructus iusticie radicatur. 6 Verumptamen Deus, qui videt corda et intelligit omnia, moderatur temptaciones amicorum suorum, ut sint eis ad profectum, quia omnia facit et permittit iuste in pondere et mensura. 7 Ergo, quia tu vocata es in spiritum Dei, noli sollicitari de longanimitate Dei, quia scriptum est, quod nemo venit ad Deum nisi Pater traxerit eum. 8 Sicut enim pastor cum fasciculo florum attrahit et allicit oues in domum, postea diligenter claudens domum, licet oues discurrant per ambitum, non tamen habebunt egressum, 9 quia domus munita est parietibus, tectum altum, ianue quoque clause, propter quod oues assuescunt comedere fenum, in tantum quod facte mansuete eciam comedunt fenum de manu pastoris, sic eciam est factum tecum. 10 Illa enim que tibi antea videbantur importabilia et difficilia, iam facta sunt leuia, in tantum quod te nichil iam delectat sicut Deus."  96 LIBRI QVARTI CAP. 13 Verba Christi ad sponsam, que lacrime sunt Deo accepte et que non; et de quibus fienda seu eroganda est elemosina pauperibus et pro animabus defunctorum; et de consilio et rogamine Christi ad sponsam. Capitulum XIII. Filius loquitur: "Miraris, cur illum non audio, quem vides habere multas lacrimas et plurima largiri pauperibus pro honore meo. 2 Respondeo tibi ad primum: Vbi duo fontes decurrunt, frequenter contingit, quod in unum conuenientes alterius aqua, que turbida est et lutosa, maculat et deturbat aquam fontis purissimi. Quam factam lutosam quis poterit bibere? 3 Sic est eciam de lacrimis multorum. Quorundam enim lacrime quandoque procedunt ex humiliacione inclinacionis nature, quandoque ex mundi tribulacione et timore inferni. 4 Talium enim lacrime lutose sunt et fetide, quia non procedunt ex caritate Dei. Set ille lacrime sunt michi dulces, que procedunt ex consideracione beneficiorum Dei et ex consideracione peccatorum suorum et amore ad Deum. 5 Tales lacrime eleuant animam a terrenis in celum et regenerant hominem ad vitam eternam. Nam duplex est generacio, carnalis et spiritualis. 6 Carnalis generacio generat hominem de immundicia ad immundiciam, plorat dampna carnis, sustinet gaudenter labores mundi. Talium filius non est filius lacrimarum, quia per tales lacrimas non acquiritur vita eterna. 7 Set illa generat filium lacrimarum, que plorat dispendia animarum, que sollicita est, A 1 Cap.  LIBRI QVARTI CAP. 14 99 hominibus loquitur, hic utique mordetur et decipitur a Dyabolo, quia verba illa, quamuis sint Dei, non procedunt de ore caritatis Dei, et lingua, scilicet consolacio Spiritus sancti, auferetur ab eo. 5 Qui vero nichil desiderat nisi Deum, omniaque mundialia sunt ei molesta, nec corpus affectat videre nec audire nisi que sunt Dei, 6 animaque eius in infusione Spiritus sancti letatur, hic talis decipi non potest, quia spiritus malus cedit spiritui bono nec audet ei appropinquare. 7 Quid vero significat mel de cauda serpentis sugere nisi consolacionem Spiritus sancti de suggestionibus Dyaboli sperare? 8 Quod nequaquam fieri potest, quia Dyabolus se magis millies occidi permitteret quam unicum verbum consolatorium daret anime, cuius exitus tenderet ad finem vite. 9 Ergo noll timere. Deus enim, qui incepit bonum tecum, perficiet usque ad finem bonum. Verumptamen scito, quod Dyabolus est quasi canis dimissus de copula, quando videt te non esse in infusione Spiritus sancti, currens ad te cum temptacionibus et suggestionibus suis. 10 Set si opposueris ei aliquod durum, quod dentes sui vel doleant vel obstupescant, statim resiliet a te nec nocebit tibi. 11 Quid vero est durum opponendum Dyabolo nisi caritas diuina et obediencia mandatorum Dei? 12 Que cum videbit Dyabolus perfecte in te, statim dentes eius, id est conatus eius et voluntas frustrabitur, quia considerat te omnia contraria magis velle pati quam mandatis Dei contraire." 4 illa] ista Ab om. ux (supra lin.) procedunt K dei non procedunt de ore caritatis om. q procedunt] tamen scilicet] id est P B ux consolacio spiritus sancti BOAb Fq spiritus sancti consolacio Kux Gh spiritus sanctus P spiritus sancti VY 5 molestia P BAb ux affectat] spectat P BOAb af- in ras. scr.  100 LIBRI QVARTI CAP. 15 Verba Christi ad sponsam, cur boni in hac vita tribulantur et mali prosperantur; et quomodo Deus probat per exemplum, quod quandoque promittit temporalia, in quibus subintelliguntur spiritualia; et quare Deus non predixit singula ad certas horas, cum omnes hore et momenta sint ei nota. Capitulum XV A 1 Filius Dei loquitur: "Miraris, cur amicum Dei honorandum audisti tribulari, inimicum vero Dei audisti honoratum, quem credebas flagellandum, sicut tibi in alia diuina visione dictum fuit. 2 Respondeo tibi: verba mea et spiritualiter et corporaliter intelligi debent. Quid enim est tribulacio mundi nisi preparacio quedam et eleuacio ad coronam? Quid vero prosperitas mundi homini abutenti gracia nisi descensus quidam ad perdicionem? 3 Ergo tribulari in mundo vera est exaltacio ad vitam. Prosperari vero in mundo homini iniusto verus descensus est ad infernum. Ideo ad instruendam pacienciam tuam in verbis Dei dico tibi unum exemplum, 4 quasi mater una esset habens duos filios, quorum unus natus fuit in obscuro carcere, nichil sciens nec audiens nisi tenebras et lac matris. Alius vero natus fuit in tugurio paruo habens cibum humanum, requiem in lecto, seruicium ab ancilla. 5 Ei vero qui in carcere natus fuit dixit mater: '0, fili, si volueris egredi a tenebris, habebis cibum delicaciorem, lectum molliorem et tuciorem locum.' 6 Quod puer audiens egressus est, quia si mater promisisset sublimiora, scilicet vel currentes equos vel domos eburneas aut latam familiam, non credidisset, 7 quia nichil nouerat nisi tenebras et lac maternum; sic et Deus quandoque parua promittit, in quibus alciora intelligit, ut homo per temporalia addiscat celestia cogitare. subintel- R promittit] permittit VY Cap. Nam naute eciam in portu nimium confidentes periclitantur. 28 Ideo iste caueat, ne veniat ad priorem statum officii sui; alioquin, nisi cauerit, amittet desiderabilia, congregata venient ad extraneos, filii non recipient hereditatem, et ipse non sine dolore apud alienos morietur." 29 Hic redfens factus est iterum exactor, et omnia ita euenerunt. Informacio optima sancte Agnetis ad filiam ad bene et laudabiliter viuen- dum et ad malam vitam et Deo ingratam precauendum; in qua fortitudo et paciencia per turrum, per quatuor vero rotas designantur iste quatuor virtutes: perfecte omnia relinquere propter Deum, humilitas et Deum sapienter diligere carnemque discrete refrenare; et ponuntur quedam alia de religiosis.  LIBRI QVARTI CAP. 18 113 9 Verumptamen, filia, ista poteris eciam intelligere spiritualiter. B Nam in Iohanne, qui interpretatur gracia Dei, notatur obediencia vera. Ipse quippe fuit et est dulcis: 10 Lohannes, dulcis parentibus propter mirabilem graciam, dulcis hominibus propter singularem predicacionem, dulcis Deo propter vite sanctitatem et obedienciam. 11 Obediuit denique in iuuentute, obediuit in prosperis et aduersis, obediuit et humiliter stetit cum honorari posset, obediuit et in morte. 12 Ergo obediencia dicit: Sede in genu!' Id est, ascende ad humilia et habebis sublimia, relinque amara et obtinebis dulcia, 13 relinque propriam voluntatem, si vis esse paruula, contempne terrena et eris celestis, contempne superflua et habebis abundanciam spiritualem. 14 In Petro vero notatur fides sancta: fides sancte Ecclesie. Sicut enim Petrus stabilis permansit usque in finem, sic et fides sancte Ecclesie sine fine stabilis permanebit. 15 Ergo Petrus, id est fides sancta, dicit: 'Aperi os, et habebis cibum optimum!' Id est: aperi intellectum anime tue et in sancta Ecclesia inuenies cibum dulcissimum, 16 id est ipsum corpus dominicum in sacramento altaris, nouam quoque legem et veterem, explanaciones doctorum, pacienciam martirum, humilitatem confessorum, virginum castimoniam omniumque virtutum fundamentum. 17 Itaque fidem sanctam quere in Ecclesia sancti Petri, quesitamque memoriter retine et operibus consumma. 18 In Paulo vero notatur paciencia. Ipse enim fuit feruens contra c impugnantes fidem sanctam, gaudens in tribulacionibus, longanimis in spe, paciens in infirmitatibus, 19 compassiuus cum dolentibus, humilis in virtutibus, hospitalis in pauperes, misericors ad peccantes, magister et doctor omnium, perseuerans usque ad finem in Dei caritate. 20 Ergo Paulus id est paciencia armabit te armis virtutum, iohannem P vera om.  116 LIBRI QVARTI CAP. 19-20 opus congratulantur et tunc vel lapides preciosos aut aurum offerunt, ut opus perficiatur. 12 Sic tu, dilecta Mater, omni conanti surgere ad Deum tribuis auxilium, et neminem relinquis vacuum a consolacione tua. Informacio sancte Agneds ad fillam de non retrocedendo et de non plus debito procedendo et de modo tenendo in abstinenciis incipiendis vel inceptis; et que continencia sit Deo acceptabilis. Capitulum XX. A 1 Agnes loquitur: "Filia, sta stabilis et non retrocedas, quia serpens mordens iacet ante talos. Nec eciam plus debito procedas, quia cuspis lancee acute ante te stat, a qua, si plus iusto processeris, vulneraberis. 2 Quid vero est retrocedere nisi penitere in temptacionibus assumpisse austeriora et salubria et velle ad consueta redire, delectari mente in sordidis cogitacionibus? 3 Talia, si menti placent, obscurant omnia bona paulatimque retrahunt ab omni bono. Nec eciam debes plus debito procedere, id est ultra vires te affligere aut allos supra naturam tuam in bonis operibus imitari, 4 quia ab eterno disposuit Deus operibus caritatis et humilitatis aperiri peccatoribus celum, seruata in omnibus mensura et discrecione. 5 Nunc autem Dyabolus inuidus suadet homini imperfecto supra vires ieiunare, promittere inconsueta et importabilia, velle imitari perfecciora non consideratis viribus propriis et infirmitatibus, 6 ut propterea] propterea et K a om. Si viderit corda hominum ex fragilitate carnis vel temptacionibus Dyaboli contra voluntatem spiritus erigere se contra Deum, statim quasi funda per inspiracionem compunccionis et penitencie illud adnichilat et facit hominem redire ad Deum et ad se ipsum. 19 Si vero venenum cupiditatis carnis vel diuiciarum intrauerit cor, mox Deus transuerberat mentem sagitta caritatis sue, ne homo perseuerans in peccato a Deo separetur. 20 Quod si aliquod immundum superbie vel lutum luxurie fedauerit animum, mox quasi anser per fidei et spei constanciam deicit, ne vel animus obduretur in viciis aut anima iuncta Deo dampnabiliter maculetur. 21 Propterea, filia, in omnibus affeccionibus tuis et operibus considera iusticiam et misericordiam Dei et semper attende finem." 14 audistis V propter] per ux 13 et presumpcio] ex presumptione P viderit 16 scito] scias K est] esset ux ei om. ux talis esset B Gh super 17 aliquod immundum] aliquid immundum ux Gh aliqua F 19 cor] cor eius spiritus] suam P F 18 dyaboli] diabolicis ux aliquid Gh 20 quod om. ux sagitta om.  122 B LIBRI QVARTI CAP. 22 homo ipse preuenit maliciam eius. Sicut canes venatici, qui primo ducuntur copulis, inde tamen assueti capere et deuorare animalia eciam in accelerando ad predam preueniunt ductorem, 3 sic iam homo assuetus et fascinatus in peccato prompcior est ad peccandum quam Dyabolus ad temptandum. Nec mirum est. Diu enim est quod sedes apostolica, caput mundi, non placauit Deum sanctitate vite et exemplo suo, sicut primitus faciebat, et ideo reliqua membra facta sunt debilia et languida. 4 Nec consideratur, cur Deus diues factus est egenus et pauper, scilicet ut peritura contempnenda doceret et celes- tia amanda. Set quod homo pauper natura factus est diues falsis diuiciis, hoc omnes imitari appetunt, paucique inueniuntur alii, qui non imitantur. 5 Ideo veniet arator a potentissimo, exacuatus a sapientissimo, qui non querit terras et pulchritudinem corporum, non veretur fortitudinem forcium nec timet minas principum, set nec accipit personas hominum; 6 qui seminabit carnes hominum et diruet domos spirituum, qui corpora tradet vermibus animasque tradet illis quibus seruierunt. 7 Ideo amici mei, ad quos te mittam, laborent viriliter et celeriter, quia non erit istud quod dico in nouissimis diebus, ut dixi prius, set in diebus istis. 8 Et multi iam viuencium eciam hoc videbunt oculis, ut impleatur quod scriptum est: Tiant uxores eorum vidue et filii sine patribus,' omneque desiderabile hominum auferatur. 9 4 Deus diues: Eph. 2,4 5 accipit personas hominum: Deut. 10,17, Gal. 2,6 8 Fiant uxores eorum vidue et filii sine patribus: Ps. 108, 9. 2 qui om. ux inde] deinde V Ab tamen om.  124 LIBRI QVARTI CAP. 23 Verba Iohannis euangeliste ad virginem gloriosam de quodam mero et iniquo ypocrita; et responsio virginis, qualiter talis sit constitutus; et de Dyaboli illusionibus ad ipsum; et quomodo ex septem signis spiritus bonus cognoscitur et ex totidem malus spiritus dinoscitur. Capitulum XXIII. Iohannes euangelista dixit Matri Dei: "Audi tu, virgo et Mater unius Filii non plurium, Mater unigeniti Filii Dei, plasmatoris et redemptoris omnium. 2 Audi, inquam, sicut et audis, quantum iste delusus est a Dyabolo, quantum laborat, ut obtineat impossibile, quantum informatus est et quantis rebus a spiritu mendacii, quantum eciam elongat se a Deo in specie ouina et corde leonino. 3 Ego docui, quod tres sunt, qui testimonium dant in celo et in terra: Pater et Filius et Spiritus sanctus. 4 Isti vero testimonium perhibet spiritus malignus, quod totus est factus sanctus. Quem Pater non fortificat potencia sua, Filius non visitat sapiencia sua, Spiritus sanctus non inflammat caritate sua. 5 Nec mirum; aspirat enim ad potenciam contra potenciam Patris, vult esse sapiens contra sapienciam habet inflammacionem set aliter quam sicut inflammat Spiritus sanctus. 6 Ideo roga Filium tuum, ut aut cicius subtrahatur, ne perdantur plures, aut humilietur celerius pro errato." 7 Respondit Mater: "Audi tu, virgo, set tamen virilis non feminea persona.
